Blending: The blend mode of the created material
ShadingModel: The shading model of the created material
MipGenSettings: The mip-map generation settings for the texture; Allows customization of the content of the mip-map chain
LODGroup: The group the texture belongs to
bDoScaleMipsForAlphaCoverage: Whether mip RGBA should be scaled to preserve the number of pixels with Value >= AlphaCoverageThresholds
bUseNewMipFilter: Whether to use newer & faster mip generation filter
AlphaCoverageThresholds: Channel values to compare to when preserving alpha coverage from a mask for mips
NoAlpha: If enabled, the texture's alpha channel will be discarded during compression
bDeferCompression: If enabled, compression is deferred until the texture is saved
bCreateMaterial: If enabled, a material will automatically be created for the texture
bRGBToBaseColor: If enabled, link the texture to the created material's base color
bRGBToEmissive: If enabled, link the texture to the created material's emissive color
bAlphaToRoughness: If enabled, link the texture's alpha to the created material's roughness
bAlphaToEmissive: If enabled, link the texture's alpha to the created material's emissive color
bAlphaToOpacity: If enabled, link the texture's alpha to the created material's opacity
bAlphaToOpacityMask: If enabled, link the texture's alpha to the created material's opacity mask
bTwoSided: If enabled, the created material will be two-sided
bPreserveBorder: If enabled, preserve the value of border pixels when creating mip-maps
bFlipNormalMapGreenChannel: If enabled, the texture's green channel will be inverted. This is useful for some normal maps
